text: I'm having a fantastic experience so far
I'm rounding out my first month I can't
believe how fast time is flying from the
beginning everyone was you know there
was an outpouring of welcome when I
walked to my desk you know there's a big
welcome sign and the first day everyone
knew my name the onboarding started
before I even began the internship my
managers and I have had a really close
relationship and even before the
internship started he proposed three
potential project ideas and got my input
into the project yes I thought we could
use this cause within the first week I
was already producing work with past
experiences it might have taken me you
know two weeks or three weeks to really
get started but having had that robust
onboarding experience and you know
building those relationships I was able
to hit the ground running so four weeks
and and everything is great so far
I'm learning a lot I'm having a lot of
fun and the company from day one my
managers was very keen on like
explaining everything that is going on
she really made sure that I have
separate one-to-one meetings with
everyone on her team and also with other
key stakeholders that because this is an
internship I would be just like
shadowing someone or be given like small
pieces of a project but that was
actually surprised in a very good way
that from day one they told me okay
we've got on this piece of the product I
came here with no background about the
printing industry but I was also
exciting for me this is how I firstly
grow like by by working in a different
industry or a different company or a
different role this feeling of learning
and you think everyday learning from the
people here I have that industry
expertise this is the very rewarding
feeling for me arts and culture is what
I fundamentally believe a basic human
right and something that I want to help
promote and enhance in our society what
I did not expect is the amount of trust
going into highly confidential and
highly strategic high-level
conversations with the very senior staff
at the Whitney Museum but on top of that
what I've really appreciated was either
cultural orientation whether it's the
dress codes and the office how different
departments work together
it is about learning the way people work
and learning about being effective in a
different culture in a different setting
and I only was able to do that through
having ongoing and regular feedback it's
been really eye-opening to see how you
can be productive impactful well really
enjoying yourself and feel that every
day is exciting it's different it's new
and it's meaningful
